description: dis- +â€Ž avow, or from Old French desavouer.

verbs.description: disavow (third-person singular simple present disavows, present participle disavowing, simple past and past participle disavowed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To strongly and solemnly refuse to own or acknowledge; to deny responsibility for, approbation of, and the like.
examples: Synonyms: abjure, deny, disclaim, disown, reject
He was charged with embezzlement, but he disavows the crime.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deny; to show the contrary of; to deny legitimacy or achievement of any kind.
examples: Synonyms: disprove, deny, impugn, reject, repudiate
Because of her dissatisfaction, she now disavows the merits of fascism.
